prompt: Dreamlike loft party, amber light, Coco on a rotating salvaged-wood platform three feet up, Tess inches away smirking, you pull soggy cardboard from your mouth revealing “INTRODUCTION SCRIPT #47,” impossible shadows, Lynch-cinematic, shallow depth of field, 35 mm grain

Rotate Tess 30° toward viewer, swap her glass for a crushed paper cup bleeding ink, speed Coco's platform to a blurry 45rpm while its stacked furniture telescopes downward, and let "SCRIPT #47" reappear as violet bruise across the carpet—keep chandelier frozen, no shadows moving.

Freeze every guest mid-motion like paused film, blur and duplicate your layered body, tint Tess’s cheek-handprint a glowing ember-mark, and let the hovering glass reflect a younger/older stranger who blinks 1s late.
Fade the upward-falling scripts into translucent dissolving butterflies; Tess now holds your script-free hand, platform rubble gone, walls glassing toward other dreams.

Replace the falling paper scripts with a flock of white origami birds mid-flight, erase the desk stack so Coco stands on empty air, and let the room dissolve into a hazy liminal glow—only Tess’s hand on the viewer’s cheek remains sharp.
